member.summary: Compares the current object with another object of the same type.
member.returns: A value that indicates the relative order of the objects being compared. The return value has the following meanings: Value Meaning Less than zero This object is less than the parameter. Zero This object is equal to . Greater than zero This object is greater than .
member.param: An object to compare with this object.

member.name: T:PIAdapters.TagRemovalOperation
member.summary: Enumeration that defines the available operations for PI tag removal during metadata synchronization.

member.name: F:PIAdapters.TagRemovalOperation.DoNotRemove
member.summary: Do not remove any existing PI tags. This is the default operation.

member.name: F:PIAdapters.TagRemovalOperation.LocalOnly
member.summary: Remove any PI tags where the PI point source matches the setting defined in the PI output adapter and the PI tag no longer exists in the local metadata. This is the recommended option when it is desirable that any locally defined tags that get removed also get removed from PI.
member.remarks: This is the least aggressive tag removal synchronization operation. Only PI tags that have a matching point source name will be considered for removal. After point source match, then any PI tags where existing measurement signal ID is not found in any extended descriptors will be removed. Note that removal of any point tags in PI metadata will cause history for removed tags to be inaccessible.

member.name: F:PIAdapters.TagRemovalOperation.FullClone
member.summary: Remove any PI tags where existing measurement signal ID is not found in any extended descriptors. Use with caution as metadata in PI will be updated to exactly match local metadata.
member.remarks: WARNING: Do not use this option if target PI instance is used for storage of any data other than this local PI adapter. This is the most aggressive tag removal synchronization operation. Any PI tags that do not exist in local metadata will be removed from PI. This option ensures that PI metadata will exactly match local metadata. Note that removal of any point tags in PI metadata will cause history for removed tags to be inaccessible.

member.name: T:PIAdapters.C37118DigitalStateSets
member.summary: Defines the available digital state sets for IEEE C37.118 connection states, quality and status word bits.
member.remarks: These digital state sets are used to expand the status word bits into individual digital tags as well as other pertinent information related to an IEEE C37.118 connection. These digital state sets are based on, and are compatible with, the digital state sets defined for the IEEE C37.118 Interface to the PI System.

member.name: F:PIAdapters.C37118DigitalStateSets.CompositeQual
member.summary: Represents the composite quality status digital state.
member.remarks: Digital tag receives a composite status from the Data Valid, PMU Error, Sync Error and Data Sorting flags. If any of these flags are set, the value of this tag will be set to 1. Otherwise, it will be zero.

member.name: F:PIAdapters.C37118DigitalStateSets.ConfigChange
member.summary: Represents the configuration change status bit digital state.
member.remarks: Digital tag that is set to 1 when the configuration change flag (bit 10) in the STAT word is true.

member.name: F:PIAdapters.C37118DigitalStateSets.ConnectState
member.summary: Represents the connect state status bit digital state.
member.remarks: Digital tag receives the current connection state.

member.name: F:PIAdapters.C37118DigitalStateSets.DataSorting
member.summary: Represents the data sorting status bit digital state.
member.remarks: Digital tag receives the Data Sorting bit (12) from the STAT word.

member.name: F:PIAdapters.C37118DigitalStateSets.DataValid
member.summary: Represents the data valid status bit digital state.
member.remarks: Digital tag receives the Data Validity bit (15) from the STAT word.

member.name: F:PIAdapters.C37118DigitalStateSets.LeapSecond
member.summary: Represents the leap second status bits digital state.
member.remarks: Digital tag receives the Leap Second quality bits (6-4) from the time quality flags.

member.name: F:PIAdapters.C37118DigitalStateSets.NominalFreq
member.summary: Represents the nominal frequency status bit digital state.
member.remarks: Nominal line frequency (FNOM) from last CONFIG block.

member.name: F:PIAdapters.C37118DigitalStateSets.PMUError
member.summary: Represents the PMU error status bit digital state.
member.remarks: Digital tag receives the PMU Error bit (14) from the STAT word.

member.name: F:PIAdapters.C37118DigitalStateSets.SyncError
member.summary: Represents the time sync error status bit digital state.
member.remarks: Digital tag receives the PMU Sync Error bit (13) from the STAT word.

member.name: F:PIAdapters.C37118DigitalStateSets.Timelock
member.summary: Represents the timelock status bits digital state.
member.remarks: Digital tag receives the Unlocked Time quality bits (5-4) from the STAT word.

member.name: F:PIAdapters.C37118DigitalStateSets.TimeQuality
member.summary: Represents the time quality status bits digital state.
member.remarks: Digital tag receives the Time Quality bits (3-0) from the time quality flags.

member.name: F:PIAdapters.C37118DigitalStateSets.Trigger
member.summary: Represents the trigger status bits digital state.
member.remarks: Digital tag receives the Trigger Reason bits (3-0) from the STAT word

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.RunMetadataSync
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this adapter should automatically manage metadata for PI points.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.AutoCreateTags
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this adapter should automatically create new tags when managing metadata for PI points.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.AutoUpdateTags
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this adapter should automatically update existing tags when managing metadata for PI points.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.AutoRemoveTags
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this adapter should automatically remove PI tags that no longer exist locally in metadata.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.SyncAlternateTagOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets flag that determines if tag synchronization should only use alternate tag fields.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.SkipDigitalAlternateTagSync
member.summary: Gets or sets flag that determines if tag synchronization should skip digitals when alternate tag field is being used.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.SkipAnalogAlternateTagSync
member.summary: Gets or sets flag that determines if tag synchronization should skip analogs when alternate tag field is being used.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.TagNamePrefixRemoveCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of tag name prefixes, e.g., "SOURCE!", applied by subscriptions to remove from PI tag names.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.PIPointSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the point source string used when automatically creating new PI points during the metadata update

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.PIPointClass
member.summary: Gets or sets the point class string used when automatically creating new PI points during the metadata update. On the PI server, this class should inherit from classic.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.UseCompression
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag that determines if compression will be used during archiving when compression is configured for tag. If disabled, configured tag compression and ReplaceValues setting are ignored.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.ReplaceValues
member.summary: Gets or sets flag that determines if existing PI values should be replaced when UseCompression is enabled.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.BadDataValueStatus
member.summary: Gets or sets the PI AF value status to use when storing measurements that have been marked as having bad data.
member.remarks: This defaults to meaning values are stored with normal status quality in PI.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.BadTimeValueStatus
member.summary: Gets or sets the PI AF value status to use when storing measurements that have been marked as having bad time.
member.remarks: This defaults to meaning values are stored with normal status quality in PI.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.UpdateExistingDescriptorState
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag that determines if the descriptor state should be updated for existing tags.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.AddTagCompressionState
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag that determines if the compression enabled state should be added for new tags.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.UpdateExistingTagCompressionState
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag that determines if the compression enabled state, per UseCompression flag, should be adjusted for existing tags, overriding existing configuration.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.CompDevDataTypeMap
member.summary: Gets or sets the defined compression deviations for data types used when AddTagCompressionState or UpdateExistingTagCompressionState is enabled.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.SpanDataTypeMap
member.summary: Gets or sets the defined value spans for data types used when AddTagCompressionState or UpdateExistingTagCompressionState is enabled.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.StepEnabledDataTypeMap
member.summary: Gets or sets the defined step enabled for values for data types used when AddTagCompressionState or UpdateExistingTagCompressionState is enabled.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.ZeroValueDataTypeMap
member.summary: Gets or sets the defined zero values for data types used when AddTagCompressionState or UpdateExistingTagCompressionState is enabled.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.ArchiveFilterDataTypes
member.summary: Gets or sets the data types to archive. Value of * (or empty string) means all values archived, DIGI means only archive digital values. Separate multiple values with a comma, for example: DIGI,VPHM,FREQ.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.ArchiveOnChangeDataTypes
member.summary: Gets or sets the data types to only archive on change. Empty string value means all values archived, * means archive all values on change, DIGI means only archive digital values on change. Separate multiple values with a comma, for example: DIGI,VPHM,FREQ.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.TagMapCacheFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the filename to be used for tag map cache.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.MaximumPointResolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum time resolution, in seconds, for data points being archived, e.g., a value 1.0 would mean that data would be archived no more than once per second. A zero value indicates that all data should be archived.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.EnableTimeReasonabilityCheck
member.summary: Gets or sets flag that indicates if incoming timestamps to the historian should be validated for reasonability.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.PastTimeReasonabilityLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of seconds that a past timestamp, as compared to local clock, will be considered valid.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.FutureTimeReasonabilityLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of seconds that a future timestamp, as compared to local clock, will be considered valid.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.ExpandStatusBitsToTags
member.summary: Gets or sets flag that determines if IEEE C37.118 status bits should be expanded to tags.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.WriteStatusWord
member.summary: Gets or sets flag that determines if status word should be written to PI as a separate tag. Commonly disabled if IEEE C37.118 status bits are expanded to tags, see .

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.ExpandQualityBitsToTags
member.summary: Gets or sets flag that determines if IEEE C37.118 quality bits should be expanded to tags.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.WriteQualityWord
member.summary: Gets or sets flag that determines if quality word should be written to PI as a separate tag. Commonly disabled if IEEE C37.118 quality bits are expanded to tags, see .

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.IEEEC37118DigitalStates
member.summary: Gets or sets the comma separated digital state set names for IEEE C37.118 status states. Specify digital state set name for each of the following digital states using value of 'X' (without quotes) as the name to indicate state is not mapped: CompositeQual, ConfigChange, ConnectState, DataSorting, DataValid, LeapSecond, NominalFreq, PMUError, SyncError, Timelock, TimeQuality, and Trigger. If digital state sets are predefined, state values are expected to be zero based and incremented by one for each value. If specified digital set name does not exist, it will be created.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.IEEEC37118TagNameExpressions
member.summary: Gets or sets the semicolon separated tag naming expressions for IEEE C37.118 status states. Specify tag naming expression for each of the following digital states: CompositeQual, ConfigChange, ConnectState, DataSorting, DataValid, LeapSecond, NominalFreq, PMUError, SyncError, Timelock, TimeQuality, and Trigger. Expression can be left blank if no digital state name is mapped for the corresponding state in .

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.ExpandDigitalBitsToTags
member.summary: Gets or sets flag that determines if digital bits should be expanded to tags.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.WriteDigitalWord
member.summary: Gets or sets flag that determines if digital word should be written to PI as a separate tag. Commonly disabled if digital bits are expanded to tags, see .

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.DigitalBitStateExpressionMap
member.summary: Gets or sets the semicolon separated pre-existing digital bit state set names mapped to a regular expression for matching digital labels. Use format "DigitalStateName=Expression;DigitalStateName=Expression;...". Use "*" for default expression.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.DigitalBitTagNameExpressionMap
member.summary: Gets or sets the semicolon separated digital state set name to tag name expression map. One expression should exist for each state defined in . Use format "DigitalStateName=Expression;DigitalStateName=Expression;...". Use "*" for default expression.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIOutputAdapter.DigitalBitExcludedExpressions
member.summary: Gets or sets the semicolon separated regular expressions for excluding digital labels from being expanded to tags.

member.summary: Returns the detailed status of the data output source.

member.name: P:PIAdapters.PIPBInputAdapter.ProcessingInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired processing interval, in milliseconds, for the adapter.
member.remarks: Except for the values of -1 and 0, this value specifies the desired processing interval for data, i.e., basically a delay, or timer interval, over which to process data. A value of -1 means to use the default processing interval while a value of 0 means to process data as fast as possible.
